Response: This text is deliberative material protected under FOIA Exemption 5, which exempts from disclosure "inter-agency or intra-agency memorandums or letters which would not be available by law to a party other than an agency in litigation with the agency." (5 U.S.C. § 552(b)(5)). The text contains internal communications between government officials discussing strategy and potential responses to a request from the National Governors Association regarding Medicaid policy. The discussions involve the potential impact of the policy on children's health and the opposition of certain governors and Democrats to the proposed policy. The text also includes opinions and recommendations regarding how to respond to the request. This type of material is protected under Exemption 5 because it is part of the decision-making process and disclosure could harm the agency's ability to make informed decisions. The case law supporting this conclusion includes NLRB v. Sears, Roebuck & Co., 421 U.S. 132 (1975), which held that Exemption 5 protects "recommendations, draft documents, proposals, suggestions, and other subjective documents which reflect the personal opinions of the writer rather than the policy of the agency."
